title: Google Analytics Setup
description: Set up Google Analytics 4 to track your website visitors and understand your audience

steps.title: Create Google Analytics Account
steps.description: Sign up for a free Google Analytics account.
steps.instructions: Go to analytics.google.com and sign in with your Google account. Click 'Start measuring'. Enter an account name (usually your company name). Configure data sharing settings as desired. Click 'Next'.
tips: Use your business Google account if you have one
Account name is for your internal organization
You can manage multiple websites under one account
Google Analytics is completely free

steps.title: Create a Property
steps.description: Set up a property for your website or app.
steps.instructions: Enter a property name (your website name). Select your reporting time zone and currency. These affect how data is displayed. Click 'Next'. This creates a Google Analytics 4 (GA4) property.
tips: Property represents your website or app
Choose timezone where most visitors are located
Currency should match your business currency
GA4 is the latest version - Universal Analytics is deprecated

steps.title: Enter Business Information
steps.instructions: Select your industry category, business size, and how you intend to use Google Analytics (improve marketing, measure traffic, etc.). This helps Google customize your dashboard. Click 'Create'.
tips: Be accurate - this affects recommendations you receive
You can select multiple use cases
This doesn't limit what you can track
Just helps Google show relevant insights

steps.title: Accept Terms of Service
steps.description: Review and accept Google Analytics terms.
steps.instructions: Read the Terms of Service Agreement. Check the box for your region (United States, Europe, etc.). Review GDPR and data processing terms if applicable. Click 'I Accept'.
tips: Terms differ by region due to data privacy laws
EU users: GDPR compliance is mandatory
Terms cover data collection and privacy
You must accept to use the service

steps.title: Set Up Data Stream
steps.description: Connect your website to Google Analytics.
steps.instructions: Choose 'Web' as your platform. Enter your website URL (e.g., https://yourwebsite.com). Name your stream (usually your website name). Enable 'Enhanced measurement' to automatically track scrolls, outbound clicks, site search, video engagement, and file downloads. Click 'Create stream'.
tips: Make sure to include https:// in your URL
Enhanced measurement is recommended for most sites
One property can have multiple data streams
Mobile apps need separate iOS/Android streams

steps.title: Get Your Tracking Code
steps.description: Copy the code you'll add to your website.
steps.instructions: After creating the stream, you'll see your 'Measurement ID' (starts with G-). Click 'View tag instructions'. Choose 'Install manually' to see the Global Site Tag code. Copy the entire code snippet - it's a <script> tag.
tips: Measurement ID format: G-XXXXXXXXXX
You'll need this ID or the full code for installation
Keep this code secure but don't worry if it's visible in your site source
You can always find this code later in Admin → Data Streams

steps.title: Install Tracking Code on Your Website
steps.description: Add the code to every page of your website.
steps.instructions:
The installation method depends on your platform:

- WordPress: Use plugin like 'MonsterInsights' or 'GA Google Analytics', enter your Measurement ID
- Shopify: Go to Online Store → Themes → Actions → Edit Code, paste in theme.liquid before </head>
- Squarespace: Settings → Advanced → Code Injection, paste in Header
- HTML site: Paste code in <head> section of every page

Save changes and publish.
tips: Code must be on every page you want to track
Using a plugin or tag manager is easier than manual installation
For WordPress: Insert Headers and Footers plugin also works
Test that code is installed correctly in next step

steps.title: Verify Installation and Explore Reports
steps.description: Confirm tracking is working and familiarize yourself with reports.
steps.instructions: In Google Analytics, go to 'Reports' → 'Realtime'. Visit your website in a new tab. You should see your visit appear in real-time. If not, check code installation. Explore other reports: Acquisition (where visitors come from), Engagement (what they do), Monetization (revenue), and Retention (return visitors).
tips: Data takes 24-48 hours to fully populate reports
Realtime report shows current activity instantly
Key metrics: Users, Sessions, Bounce Rate, Avg Session Duration
Set up goals to track conversions (purchases, sign-ups)
Enable Demographics in Admin → Property Settings → Data Collection
Link Google Analytics with Google Search Console for SEO data
Check reports weekly to understand traffic patterns
Use insights to improve your marketing and content
